intro: Triumfetta japonica, commonly known as Japanese glorybower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. It has palmately lobed leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Triumfetta japonica is relatively drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
